DOC.brief_summary: Patients present ACS ( Acute Coronary Syndrome ) emergency department screen clinical eligibility ask sign inform consent study . A total 40 patient randomize . 20 receive Trapidil elute stent ( Intrepide™ stent ) , 20 receive Paclitaxel elute stent ( Taxus™ stent ) . After 90 day patient treat INTREPIDE stent first lesion treat Taxus stent second lesion . After 90 day patient treat Taxus stent first lesion treat INTREPIDE stent second lesion . Coronary angiography perform femoral ( groin ) radial ( wrist ) artery use standard technique . The doctor determine patient qualify enrolment end diagnostic coronary angiogram
DOC.brief_title: Optical Coherence Tomography ( OCT ) Evaluation Re-endothelization : A Comparison Intrepide™ Stent Versus Taxus™
DOC.criteria: Clinical > 18 year age , symptom non STelevation ACS ( define ACC/AHA criterion ) 30 min < 48 h Patient must provide write informed consent prior procedure use form approve local Institutional Review Board Angiographic reference vessel diameter culprit/target lesion 2.25 3.5 mm ( visual estimate ) discrete target lesion ( maximum length 28 mm visual estimation ) target lesion native coronary artery presence another lesion 70 % vessel different culprit one amenable plan percutaneous treatment 90 day thereafter . Clinical previously document leave ventricular ejection fraction le 30 % estimate life expectancy le 12 month history bleed diathesis , leukopenia , thrombocytopenia , severe hepatic renal dysfunction participation another study inability give inform consent owe prolonged cardiopulmonary resuscitation dominant Renal impairment ( serum creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl ) Angiographic nonculprit lesion locate proximal LAD proximal dominant Circumflex artery previous PCI target vessel restenosis stent thrombosis culprit lesion unprotected leave main coronary artery disease nonculprit lesion locate vein graft severe multivessel disease ( three major epicardial vessel disease ) need overlap stenting one lesion
